name: Chef John's Red Beans and Rice
author: Chef John
summary: Any time someone asks the question, 'What exactly is soul food?' the answer should always be 'a comforting bowl of red beans and rice.' Just sit them down, give them a spoon, and when they finish, ask them if they understand. They will.
ingredients: 2 quarts chicken broth, or more as needed
½ teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste
2 tablespoons chopped green onion, or to taste
directions: Place beans in a large container and cover with several inches of cool water; let stand 8 hours to overnight
Heat vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat
Cook and stir sausage in hot oil until oils slightly release from sausage and edges brown, 5 to 7 minutes
Stir onion, celery, and poblano pepper into sausage; cook and stir until vegetables soften and start to turn translucent, 5 to 10 minutes
Stir garlic into sausage mixture; cook and stir until fragrant, about 1 minute

Stir red beans, chicken broth, ham hock, bay leaves, black pepper, thyme, cayenne pepper, and hot sauce into the sausage mixture; bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer gently, stirring occasionally, for 1 1/2 hours
Add salt and continue simmering until beans are soft, meat is tender, and desired consistency is reached, 1 1/2 to 2 hours more
Spoon rice into bowls, ladle red beans mixture over rice, and top with green onion
